description: Let m = 3, 5, 7, ..., k = 0, 1, 2, 3, ..., z = (m+1)/2, 0 < j <= m. Let n_j be a prime number. Sequence gives T(m,k) = Table[m,k] = number of solutions to Sum_{d=1,2, ..., (z+k)}(n_j)_d = Sum_{d=1,2, ..., (z-k-1)}(n_j)_d = primorial number (A002110).
formula: A022894(m) = Sum_{k=0, 1, 2, ..} [Number of solutions to Sum_{d=1, 2, ..., (z+k)}(n_j)_d = Sum_{ d=1, 2, ..., (z-k-1)}(n_j)_d]
author: _Naohiro Nomoto_, Nov 27 2000
